activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek S. Nehls

defendant.name: Nehls, Derek S.
defendant.address: E2573 Porter Road, Lone Rock, WI 53556-9652

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:25 PM Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court.  Attorney Stephen Eric Mays in court for Derek S. Nehls.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mays states that they are prepared to waive the preliminary hearing. Court will accept the waiver of a preliminary hearing and binds him over for trial. 

Attorney Harper brings forth the same charges. Attorney Mays waives the formal reading and stand mute. Court speaks about max penalties. 
Attorney Mays asks for a status.
Preliminary hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:44 AM Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court with Atty. Stephen Mays. DA Harper appeared for the Court. Court states the charges and informs Def of the max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim. Further reading waived. Prelim requested, time limits waived.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:20 PM Defendant Derek Nehls appeared by video. Attorney Orth appears by video (appearing for this hearing only). Attorney Forehand appears for the state. 
Attorney Forehand ask for a $5,000 cash bond with no contact with victims/witnesses (BH, EI, BI, JS)
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Attorney Orth speaks about DN history and notes there is no history of any missed court appearances. Attorney Orth comments about prior cases. Attorney Orth doesn't object to the no contact. DN request that  no drink provisions. Attorney Orth request a signature bond.

Court orders $1,000 cash bond.
No contact with victims/witnesses (BH, EI, BI, JS)
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.
